21 Barefoot atoll, the Maldives
13h15m 29 9
It’s tempting to take an atoll and turn it into a stilted outpost of urban chic, with underwater spas, wine cellars and Hoxton-style fish’n’chip shops. Cocoa Island prefers a simpler approach, selling the purest form of desert-island idyll in the Maldives. It has just 33 suites, all above the sea, a tiny beachside spa, a bar and a restaurant. Activities include free yoga classes, fishing, swimming and sleeping, and the only celeb you’ll meet is Abdullah, the one-legged heron.
From £3,499pp; 01244 355570, itcluxurytravel.co.uk
22 A-list Baja, Mexico
20h 26 10
The Mexican resort of Cabo San Lucas is a two-hour flight from Los Angeles, which explains why this glamorous town on the tip of the Baja peninsula is crawling with celebrities. The A-list favours Esperanza, the epitome of luxury,
